required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Perioperative Pregabalin in Ureteroscopy: a Pilot
clinical_study.official_title: Perioperative Pregabalin as Part of a Multimodal Treatment Plan for Pain After Ureteroscopy With Stent Placement: a Pilot

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators propose a pilot clinical trial on the use of perioperative pregabalin in order to decrease ureteral stent related symptoms and decrease opioid usage after ureteroscopy with stent placement. Patients undergoing ureteroscopy with stent placement will receive a single dose of 300 mg pregabalin PO in the preoperative area. This work will assess safety and feasibility of studying this regimen at our institution, with the aim of performing a randomized, placebo-controlled, double-blinded study in the future.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All participants will receive 300mg PO pregabalin one hour before procedure start
study_design_info.masking_description: There will be no blinding for this pilot

primary_outcome.measure: Adverse events related to study drug
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events related to study drug, mainly in post anesthesia care unit
Verified correct administration of study drug
Questionnaire respondent self-report of usability of instrument

secondary_outcome.description: Ureteral Stent Related Symptom Questionnaire (USSQ) score. Subscores include the following: Urinary Index Score (11-57). Higher scores indicates worse outcomes. Pain Index Score (6-30) Higher scores indicates worse outcomes. General Health Index Score (6-30). Higher scores indicates worse outcomes. Work Performance Score (3-15). Higher scores indicates worse outcomes. Sexual Matters( 2-10) Higher scores indicates worse outcomes. Additional Problems with the stent in situ (4-17) Higher scores indicates worse outcomes. Global Quality of life with the stent in situ (1-7). Higher scores indicates worse outcomes.
Monitored prescribing of narcotic pain medication
Opioid use for any indication at several time points
Amount of opioid used for any indication at several time points, in oral morphine equivalents
Number of unplanned contacts between the patient and the healthcare system

Score on standardized evaluation of patient satisfaction at various time points. There are two questions graded from very dissatisfied to very satisfied regarding pain related satisfaction and overall satisfaction.

arm_group.description: 300mg pregabalin, PO, once, 1 hr before surgery

intervention.description: One 300mg capsule will be administered PO 1 hour before surgery

criteria.textblock:
Subject Population Undergoing elective ureteroscopy with stent placement by Dr. Murray at University of Missouri Hospital and affiliated facilities
Subject Inclusion
Age >= 18 years
Subject Exclusion
- Renal insufficiency (eGFR < 30 mL/minute/1.73 m2)
- Chronic indwelling ureteral stent
- Chronic opioid use
- History of opioid abuse
- Chronic gabapentinoid use
- Plan for inpatient hospitalization
- Pregnancy
- Inability of the patient to consent for themselves in English
- Allergy to gabapentinoid
- Liver failure or hepatic dysfunction

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Informed Consent Form
